ipcalc

Class IpCalc

  • java.lang.Object
    • ipcalc.IpCalc

  • public class IpCalc
extends java.lang.Object

    IPv4 address calculator

    IpCalc is a useful command line tool to quickly calculate network part and host part given ip and subnet or CIDR. It can also print all IP addresses from a given range. Examples: calculate network part and print number of hosts $ ipcalc 192.168.2.0/24 print all hosts in a given network $ ipcalc -pa 127.0.0-255.0-255 $ ipcalc -pa 127.0.0.0-127.0.255.255 $ ipcalc -pa 127.0.0.0/16 calculate network part and sub or supernet $ ipcalc 192.168.0.1 255.255.255.0 255.255.0.0 $ ipcalc 192.168.0.1/24/16 Options: -pa --print-all print all addresses from a given range -v --verbose print binary representation -e --education print info about IPv4 address space
    Since:
    2016-10-30
